intro: Tabernaemontana repoevensis, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
